meanings.definition: A meal eaten in the middle of the day.
meanings.sent1: During the school day, students enjoy their lunched in the cafeteria.
meanings.sent2: My favorite part of the day is when I have my lunched with my friends.
meanings.sent3: The lunched I had today was so delicious, it made me smile.
meanings.sent4: Her lunched was a colorful array of fruits and sandwiches, like a picnic on a plate.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the lunched filled the room, tempting everyone to take a bite.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I lunched with my colleagues at the new restaurant in town.
meanings.sent2: She lunched quickly before heading back to work.
meanings.sent3: The cat lunched on the mouse, surprising everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The idea lunched into his mind like a sudden burst of light.
meanings.sent5: As the clock struck noon, they lunched on the freshly baked bread.
